abstract: After more than a decade, Dr. Tom Doerr and his brother, John, see a possible turning point for their business with Apple’s iPad and a national mandate for digital medical records.
snippet: After more than a decade, Dr. Tom Doerr and his brother, John, see a possible turning point for their business with Apple’s iPad and a national mandate for digital medical records.
lead_paragraph: There is no silver bullet for reforming America’s health care system, but medical experts have long agreed that digital patient records and electronic prescribing can help improve care and curb costs.

headline.main: 2 Brothers Await Broad Use of Medical E-Records

abstract: John Doerr, the well-known venture capitalist, and his brother, Dr. Tom Doerr, a physician and software designer, see a possible turning point for their business with Apple’s iPad and a national mandate for digital medical records.
snippet: John Doerr, the well-known venture capitalist, and his brother, Dr. Tom Doerr, a physician and software designer, see a possible turning point for their business with Apple’s iPad and a national mandate for digital medical records.
lead_paragraph: There is no silver bullet for reforming America’s health care system, but medical experts have long agreed that digital patient records and electronic prescribing can help improve care and curb costs, The New York Times’s Steve Lohr reports.

headline.main: Doerr Brothers Spy Turning Point on Medical E-Records

abstract: The company challenged a jury award to a company founded by David Gelernter, a Yale professor, related to file display on the iPod, the iPhone and Mac computers.
snippet: The company challenged a jury award to a company founded by David Gelernter, a Yale professor, related to file display on the iPod, the iPhone and Mac computers.
lead_paragraph: Apple is challenging a jury verdict that could force it to pay as much as $625.5 million to a company founded by David Gelernter, a Yale computer science professor, for infringing three patents related to how files are displayed on the iPod, the iPhone and Macintosh computers.

headline.main: Apple Challenges Big Award Over Patents
headline.print_headline: Apple Challenges Big Award Over Patents

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and John Schwartz
